title: Yes, Trump can win the 2024 election. Here are four reasons why
description: He has been impeached twice, tried to thwart the peaceful transfer of power after losing the 2020 presidential election, faces scores of charges in multiple criminal cases, and his critics warn he is plotting to rule as an autocrat. Yet, Donald Trump could still return to the White House.

title: Poland's new PM Donald Tusk presents pro-EU vision
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk set out a pro-European Union vision and pledged strong support for Ukraine on Tuesday, a day after his appointment ended eight years of nationalist rule that soured relations with the EU.

title: Ireland to cut allowance, housing for new Ukrainian arrivals
description: Ireland will slash the allowance for newly arrived Ukrainian refugees using state accommodation to 38.80 euros ($41.90) per week from 220 euros and put a 90-day limit on the time they can remain housed by the state, the government said on Tuesday.

title: Trybunał uznał, że Polska ogranicza prawa osób LGBT. Tusk i Duda muszą im to teraz wspólnie wynagrodzić
description: Zapadł wyrok w Strasburgu w sprawie osób LGBT. Dotyczy on naruszania przez Polskę konwencji praw człowieka

title: 'People are all but dead', Gazan mother speaks of war's horror
description: When an Israeli air strike hit her neighbourhood and destroyed her home, Faten Abu Khoseh ran into the street to desperately look for her youngest child who had been walking to the market.

title: Houthi attacks direct threat to Israel’s maritime trade – Ashdod port
description: Attacks on commercial vessels by Yemen’s Houthis are a threat to global shipping routes and seaborne traffic to Israel although there has been no direct impact on port activity, Israel’s Port of Ashdod said on Tuesday.

title: Prawo
description: System prawny Polski opiera się na hierarchii norm prawnych, z Konstytucją Rzeczypospolitej Polskiej na najwyższym szczeblu, ustanawiającej podstawowe zasady i struktury państwa oraz prawa i wolności obywatelskie. Niżej w hierarchii znajdują się ustawy, akty normatywne oraz akty prawa miejscowego. System prawny Polski obejmuje różne gałęzie prawa, z których każda reguluje inne aspekty życia społecznego, gospodarczego czy politycznego. Prawo publiczne zawiera normy regulujące stosunki między jednostką a władzami publicznymi oraz stosunki między różnymi organami państwa. Do gałęzi prawa publicznego zaliczają się: Prawo konstytucyjne – badające struktury i funkcje organów państwa oraz prawa i wolności obywatelskie. Prawo administracyjne – regulujące organizację i działalność administracji publicznej. Prawo karne – określające czyny zabronione i sankcje za ich popełnienie. Prawo finansowe – odnoszące się do systemu finansowego państwa. Prawo Międzynarodowe Publiczne – regulujące stosunki

Od 10 lat tworzy treści dla mediów online, agencji reklamowych i prywatnych klientów. Specjalizuje się w treściach z zakresu nieruchomości, finansów i praw przedsiębiorców. title: Nie musisz płacić każdego rachunku, którzy przyjdzie na twojego maila. Czasem sam zabierze sobie twoje pieniądze
description: Cyberbezpieczeństwo stało się kluczowym zagadnieniem dla firm w obliczu rosnącej liczby ataków phishingowych, szczególnie intensyfikujących się w okresie końca roku fiskalnego i przed świąteczną przerwą. Eksperci ds. cyberbezpieczeństwa z ESET ostrzegają przed nową falą ataków phishingowych, które mogą zagrażać poufności danych firmowych. title: Redakcja serwisu

Autorzy Bezprawnika to grupa osób o różnych, często sprzecznych względem siebie poglądach. Blog nie prezentuje jednolitej linii ideologicznej. title: Państwo
description: Polska, jako suwerenne państwo, jest republiką, w której ustrojowi prawnemu przysługuje określenie demokratycznego państwa prawa. Znaczy to, że zarówno organy państwowe, jak i obywatele działają w granicach i na zasadach określonych w prawie, a nadrzędną rolę pełni Konstytucja Rzeczypospolitej Polskiej z 1997 roku. Trójpodział władzy w państwie W strukturze ustrojowej Polski wyróżnia się trzy główne władze: ustawodawczą, wykonawczą i sądowniczą. Władzę ustawodawczą sprawuje parlament dwuizbowy, składający się z Sejmu i Senatu, którego głównym zadaniem jest uchwalanie ustaw. Wybory do Sejmu i Senatu są powszechne, równe, bezpośrednie i proporcjonalne. Władza wykonawcza złożona jest z Prezydenta RP i Rady Ministrów. Prezydent, jako głowa państwa, pełni funkcję reprezentacyjną, jest najwyższym dowódcą Sił Zbrojnych i gwarantem ciągłości władzy państwowej. Rada Ministrów, na czele z Premierem, kieruje bieżącą polityką wewnętrzną i zagraniczną Polski. Władza sądownicza jest niezależna i s

title: Ethiopia peace minister critical of PM Abiy held for suspected coup plot
description: Ethiopia’s state minister of peace has been fired and arrested on accusations he conspired with rebel groups to overthrow the government, state media reported on Tuesday.

title: Orphans of Gaza war left with no close relatives to care for them
description: Playing with dolls on a Gaza hospital bed where she sits with her leg in a plaster cast and scars on her face, 10-year-old Razan Shabat does not know that her mother, father and siblings were killed in the strike that wounded her.

title: Vatican eases rules on the ashes of the dead
description: A small part of a dead person's cremated ashes may be stored in a place that was dear to them rather than in a church or cemetery, the Vatican said on Tuesday, softening its previous stance on the issue.

title: UK News | Top Stories from the UK | Reuters
description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest UK news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

title: EU agrees tougher rules to seize criminal, sanctioned assets
description: The European Union reached agreement on Tuesday on rules to make freezing and confiscation of criminal assets more effective, including boosting the capacity of EU countries to identify assets of Russian or Belarusian people subject to sanctions.

title: Kenya to scrap visas for all visitors, president says
description: Visitors to Kenya from across the world will no longer require a visa from January, President William Ruto said on Tuesday.

title: France to host meeting on tackling Hamas financing, online activities
description: Officials from more than 20 countries including Israel but no Arab states will convene in Paris on Wednesday to define a strategy on how to curb financing of Hamas and its activities online, three diplomats said.

title: German anti-drone project costs increase fivefold - Spiegel
description: The planned procurement of an anti-drone system by Germany's defence ministry will end up being five times more expensive than initially expected, Spiegel magazine reported on Tuesday.

title: Africa News | Latest Top Stories | Reuters
description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest Africa news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

title: Explainer: What is the UK's Rwanda migrant deportation bill?
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's new bill, which seeks to send asylum seekers who arrive illegally in Britain to Rwanda, faces a key vote in parliament on Tuesday.

title: South Korea's Yoon arrives in Netherlands, will visit ASML
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol laid a wreath at the Netherlands' national monument in Amsterdam on Tuesday at the start of a two-day visit during which he will also tour the headquarters of tech powerhouse ASML .

title: Sweden says Hungary sticking to promise over NATO accession
description: Hungary has repeated a promise that it will not be the last NATO country to ratify Sweden's application to join the alliance, Swedish Foreign Minister Tobias Billstrom said on Tuesday after meeting his Hungarian counterpart earlier in the week.

title: Bab al-Mandab shipping lane a target as Israel fights Hamas
description: Yemen's Houthis have been targeting vessels in the southern Red Sea and the Bab al-Mandab strait in attacks the Iran-aligned group says aim to support the Palestinians as Israel and Hamas wage war.

title: US condemns rising violence in Burkina Faso -State Dept
description: The United States is concerned about human rights in Burkina Faso and condemns the "violence committed by terrorist groups against civilians, military, and police" in the West African country, the U.S. State Department said on Tuesday.

title: Rwanda sets July election date for presidential and parliamentary polls
description: Rwanda will hold presidential and parliamentary elections in July next year, when President Paul Kagame will seek to extend his roughly three decades in control of the East African country.

title: Asylum seeker dies on board UK barge housing migrants
description: An asylum seeker has died on board a barge housing migrants off the south coast of England, British police and interior minister James Cleverly said on Tuesday.

title: EU must convince Hungary over Ukraine aid at summit, German official says
description: The European Union aims to convince holdout Hungary to back its proposed 50 billion euro ($54 billion) aid facility for Kyiv at its summit this week to send a clear signal to Russia, a German government official said.

title: India requests FBI to share intel on Sikh separatists - source
description: India has requested the United States to share intelligence on Sikh separatists living there amid investigations into an accusation that an Indian official was linked to a plot to kill a Sikh separatist on American soil, an Indian official said on Tuesday.

title: India News | Today's Top Stories | Reuters
description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest India news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

title: Egypt's Sisi cruises towards victory in subdued election
description: Egyptians cast their ballots on Tuesday on the third and last day of a presidential election expected to give President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi a sweeping victory in the absence of real competition.

title: Guinea-Bissau president reappoints Geraldo Martins as PM
description: Guinea-Bissau's President Umaro Sissoco Embalo has reappointed Geraldo Martins as prime minister after dissolving his government last week, he said in a statement on Tuesday.

title: Pakistan court overturns ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's last graft conviction
description: A Pakistan court on Tuesday overturned a conviction for graft of former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, his lawyer said, removing one of the last major hurdles for him to qualify to contest national elections in February.

title: Russia opens new criminal case against U.S. Radio Free Europe journalist - media report
description: Russian investigators have opened a new criminal case against a Russian-American journalist being held in detention, accusing her of spreading false information about the Russian army, a state-affiliated media outlet reported on Tuesday.

title: Spanish police seize 7.5 tonnes of cocaine hidden in frozen tuna fish
description: Spanish police in the northwestern port of Vigo seized 7.5 tonnes of cocaine from South America hidden inside frozen tuna fish due to be distributed across Europe, it said on Tuesday.

title: UK condemns China over incidents in the South China Sea against Philippines
description: Britain on Monday condemned what it called "unsafe and escalatory tactics deployed by Chinese vessels" against the Philippines over the weekend in the South China Sea.

title: UN General Assembly set to demand Gaza ceasefire
description: The U.N. General Assembly appeared set to demand on Tuesday an immediate humanitarian ceasefire in the two-month long conflict between Israel and Hamas after the United States vetoed such a move in the Security Council.

title: Old foes China and Vietnam agree to build 'shared future'
description: Old foes China and Vietnam, at odds over claims in the South China Sea, declared on Tuesday they want to boost ties and build a community with a "shared future", just three months after Hanoi upgraded its formal relations with the United States.

title: Malaysia PM aims to rebuild trust with major cabinet reshuffle
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim made major changes to his cabinet on Tuesday, appointing the chief of the country's largest state pension fund as second finance minister in an effort to rebuild trust after a year in office.

title: Biden alludes to disagreements with Israel's Netanyahu
description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Monday alluded to the complex relationship he has with Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu, suggesting the prime minister is in a "tough spot" and that the two have had their share of disagreements over the years and at present.

title: Turkish Cypriots reject 'malicious' Israel allegation
description: Turkish Cypriot authorities have denied an "unfounded and malicious allegation" by Israel that Iran was using northern Cyprus for "terrorism objectives".

title: Nuclear warnings serve Putin's purpose as he bids for new term
description: The prospect of six more years in power for Russian President Vladimir Putin is likely to mean no let-up in nuclear tensions with the United States, as time runs out on the last remaining treaty that limits the number of warheads each side can deploy.

title: Yemen's Houthis claim attack on Norwegian tanker in tense Middle East
description: Yemen's Houthis said on Tuesday they carried out a military operation against a Norwegian commercial tanker in their latest protest against Israel's bombardment of Gaza, underlining the risks of a conflict that has shaken the Middle East.

title: Trump holds wide lead in Republican 2024 nominating contest, Reuters/Ipsos poll shows
description: The former U.S. president is drawing the support of more than half of the party's voters, according to a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll completed on Monday. None of his rivals were anywhere close.

title: Austria makes conditional 'Air Schengen' offer to Bulgaria, Romania
description: Austria, which has led opposition within the European Union to Romania and Bulgaria joining the Schengen open-travel area, said on Monday it was willing to relent but only on plane travel and in exchange for tighter security at the EU's external border.

title: Latest U.S. News | Top headlines from the USA | Reuters
description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest US news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

title: Zelenskiy makes 11th hour plea for Ukraine war funds in Washington
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Tuesday plans a last-ditch plea to U.S. lawmakers to keep military support flowing as he battles Russia, in visits to the White House and Capitol Hill.

title: Middle East News | Today's Latest Stories | Reuters
description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest Middle-East news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

title: Asia News | Latest Top Stories | Reuters
description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest Asia news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

title: US House expects Wednesday vote on formalizing Biden impeachment inquiry - aide
description: The Republican-controlled U.S. House of Representatives is expected to vote on Wednesday to formalize its impeachment inquiry of Democratic President Joe Biden, a Republican leadership aide said on Monday.

title: Israel pounds Gaza as hunger spreads, disease risk grows
description: Israeli tanks and warplanes pummelled southern Gaza on Tuesday, and the U.N. said aid distribution to Gazans facing growing hunger had largely halted because of the intensity of fighting in the Israel-Hamas war, now in its third month.

title: Militant suicide truck attack kills 23 Pakistani soldiers
description: A six-man suicide squad drove an explosive-laden truck into a military camp in northwest Pakistan, inflicting the heaviest death toll in a single attack in years.

title: France to end contract with biggest Muslim high school amid fears of wider crackdown
description: France is to end funding for its biggest Muslim high school on the grounds of administrative failures and questionable teaching practices, a local official said on Monday, the latest in what some rights groups say is a wider crackdown on Muslims.

title: Russians banned from travel to hand over passports within five days
description: Russians who have been banned from travelling abroad will have to hand over their passports to authorities within five days after being notified, according to a government decree that comes into force on Monday.

title: Japanese ex-soldier wins battle for justice in landmark sexual assault case
description: A Japanese court on Tuesday found three former soldiers guilty of sexually assaulting a female colleague, in a victory for the victim whose battle for justice challenged taboos in a traditional, male-dominated society.

title: Europe News | Latest Headlines & Stories | Reuters
description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest Europe news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

title: World News | Latest Top Stories | Reuters
description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest world news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

title: 1500 zł dodatku dla rodziców już w 2024 r. Tusk informuje, jakie obietnice zostaną zrealizowane w pierwszej kolejności
description: Podwyżki dla nauczycieli i budżetówki to nie wszystko. Już od przyszłego roku ma wejść w życie również nowy dodatek.

title: Buduje się coraz mniej mieszkań, a w dodatku coraz mniejszych. I dłużej trzeba na nie czekać
description: Z danych przedstawionych przez GUS wynika, że w ostatnim czasie w Polsce buduje się coraz mniej mieszkań, a ich powierzchnia spada.

title: Za gapiostwo, głupi żart dziecka lub celową próbę oszukania sprzedawcy grozi nawet 8 lat więzienia. Chodzi o płatność
description: Płacenie pamiątkowymi banknotami to próba oszustwa, czy zwyczajne niedbalstwo płacących? Nieważne, i tak grozi nam odsiadka.

title: Tusk ma złożyć przedsiębiorcom ważną obietnicę. I jak najszybciej ją zrealizować
description: ZUS wypłaci chorobowe od pierwszego dnia nieobecności pracownika. Rząd Tuska ma złożyć obietnicę szybkiej realizacji zmian.

title: Philippines summons Chinese ambassador over South China Sea 'harassment'
description: The Philippines' foreign ministry said on Tuesday it has summoned China's ambassador to Manila to protest "back-to-back harassments" in the South China Sea at the weekend, as longstanding geopolitical tensions continue in the strategic waterway.

title: Rycerskość w narodzie nie ginie, czyli o mruganiu długimi podczas jazdy samochodem
description: Mruganie długimi światłami to nie tylko miły gest w stronę innych kierowców. To również narażenie siebie na mandat.

title: Nuclear warnings serve Putin's purpose as he bids for new term
description: The prospect of six more years in power for Russian President Vladimir Putin is likely to mean no let-up in nuclear tensions with the United States, as time runs out on the last remaining treaty that limits the number of warheads each side can deploy.

title: Strony nie znaleziono - Bezprawnik
description: Strony nie znaleziono - Bezprawnik

title: Turkish Cypriots reject 'malicious' Israel allegation
description: Turkish Cypriot authorities have denied an "unfounded and malicious allegation" by Israel that Iran was using northern Cyprus for "terrorism objectives".

title: Zelenskiy makes 11th hour plea for Ukraine war funds in Washington
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Tuesday plans a last-ditch plea to U.S. lawmakers to keep military support flowing as he battles Russia, in visits to the White House and Capitol Hill.

title: Tutaj pracy nie brakuje. Firmy ciągle potrzebują pracowników o tych kompetencjach
description: Firmy potrzebują pracowników o kompetencjach technicznych. Do 2025 roku około 50 proc. pracowników będzie musiało się przebranżowić.

title: Pakistan militants raid police station to kill four, injure 28
description: Militants stormed a police station in northwest Pakistan on Tuesday, killing four security officials and wounding several more, officials said, in a bomb and gun attack for which a Pakistani Taliban group claimed responsibility.

title: UN General Assembly set to demand Gaza ceasefire
description: The U.N. General Assembly appeared set to demand on Tuesday an immediate humanitarian ceasefire in the two-month long conflict between Israel and Hamas after the United States vetoed such a move in the Security Council.

title: Korytarz życia w teorii musimy tworzyć zawsze, gdy robi się korek. Nieważne czy jedzie karetka, czy kolumna z ministrem
description: Uprawnienia pojazdu uprzywilejowanego nie zawsze są równoznaczne z prawem do ignorowania przepisów ruchu drogowego.

title: Japan court finds three guilty of sexually assaulting ex-soldier in landmark case
description: A Japanese court on Tuesday found three former soldiers guilty of sexually assaulting a female colleague, in a victory for the victim's long battle for justice.

title: Myanmar is now world's largest source of opium, UN says
description: Myanmar has become the world's largest source of opium, thanks to domestic instability and a decline in cultivation in Afghanistan, the United Nations said in a report on Tuesday.

title: Children are the best investment for China, says Beijing think tank
description: Children are the most worthy investment for China's economy to help stimulate consumption and expand domestic demand a Beijing policy institute said, after the country posted its first population drop in more than six decades last year.

title: Malaysia PM makes multiple changes in cabinet reshuffle
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim reshuffled his cabinet on Tuesday with multiple changes, including to the foreign, defence and energy portfolios and the return of a second finance minister, as he looks to rebuild trust after a year in office.

title: Cruise missile from Yemen strikes tanker ship -US officials
description: A land-based cruise missile launched from Houthi-controlled Yemen has struck a commercial tanker vessel, causing a fire and damage but no casualties, two U.S. defence officials told Reuters on Monday.

title: Biden alludes to disagreements with Israel's Netanyahu
description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Monday alluded to the complex relationship he has with Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu, suggesting the prime minister is in a "tough spot" and that the two have had their share of disagreements over the years and at present.

title: UK condemns China over incidents in the South China Sea against Philippines
description: Britain on Monday condemned what it called "unsafe and escalatory tactics deployed by Chinese vessels" against the Philippines over the weekend in the South China Sea.

title: Hunger rises in Gaza as UN prepares to vote on ceasefire resolution
description: Hunger was worsening among Palestinians in the besieged Gaza strip, aid agencies said, as the United Nations General Assembly prepared to vote on Tuesday on an immediate humanitarian ceasefire in the two-month-old conflict between Israel and Hamas.

title: China's Xi visits Vietnam after Biden, seeks to boost ties
description: China's President Xi Jinping starts a two-day visit to Vietnam on Tuesday, three months after U.S. President Joe Biden travelled to Hanoi as the two great powers vie for influence in the Southeast Asian nation.

title: US House expects Wednesday vote on formalizing Biden impeachment inquiry - aide
description: The Republican-controlled U.S. House of Representatives is expected to vote on Wednesday to formalize its impeachment inquiry of Democratic President Joe Biden, a Republican leadership aide said on Monday.
